olympiads.name: International Mathematical Olympiad
olympiads.subject: Mathematics
olympiads.description: The most prestigious mathematics competition for high school students worldwide, established in 1959. Tests problem-solving skills in algebra, geometry, number theory, and combinatorics.
olympiads.eligibility: Students under 20 years old (by July 1), not enrolled in tertiary education

resources.title: A Primer for Mathematics Competitions
resources.description: Essential preparation book covering all major olympiad topics with worked examples and practice problems.

resources.title: Art of Problem Solving (AoPS) Forum
resources.description: The largest online community for mathematics competition students with extensive problem archives.

resources.title: IMO Official Problem Archive
resources.description: Complete archive of all IMO problems from 1959 to present with official solutions.

faq.question: How early should I start preparing?
faq.answer: Ideally 2-3 years of consistent preparation. Grade 9-10 is optimal to start serious olympiad training.

faq.question: Is coaching necessary?
faq.answer: No, self-study with proper resources and discipline is sufficient. Many successful participants prepared independently using online resources.

faq.question: How much time should I dedicate daily?
faq.answer: 2-3 hours of focused problem-solving daily is recommended, with more intensive preparation closer to competitions.

olympiads.name: International Physics Olympiad
olympiads.subject: Physics
olympiads.description: Annual physics competition for high school students, testing theoretical and experimental skills. Started in 1967, it's the most prestigious physics olympiad.
olympiads.eligibility: Students in secondary education, under 20 years old (by June 30), haven't entered university

resources.title: Problems in General Physics
resources.description: Classic problem book covering all physics olympiad topics with challenging problems.

resources.title: IPhO Problem Collections
resources.description: Complete archive of past IPhO problems and solutions.

faq.question: What topics should I focus on?
faq.answer: Master mechanics and electromagnetism first, then expand to thermodynamics, optics, and modern physics. Experimental skills are equally important.

faq.question: How is the experimental exam structured?
faq.answer: A 3-hour practical examination where you design experiments, collect data, and analyze results using provided equipment.

olympiads.name: International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics
olympiads.subject: Astronomy & Astrophysics
olympiads.description: Tests knowledge in astronomy, astrophysics, celestial mechanics, and observational techniques. Includes theoretical, practical (data analysis), and observational rounds.

notableAchievements: Bronze Medal at 27th IOAA (China, Nov 2023) - Drishant Kumar Maharjan

specialProgram.name: IOAA Junior
specialProgram.note: Nepal hosted 3rd IOAA-jr in October 2024 in Kathmandu Valley

resources.title: Stellarium
resources.description: Free planetarium software for sky observation practice.

resources.title: IOAA Past Problems
resources.description: Official archive of IOAA problems covering theoretical, data analysis, and observational rounds.

olympiads.name: International Chemistry Olympiad
olympiads.subject: Chemistry
olympiads.description: International competition testing chemistry knowledge and experimental abilities.
olympiads.eligibility: Under 20 years old (by July 1), currently in high school

olympiads.name: International Biology Olympiad
olympiads.subject: Biology
olympiads.description: International competition testing biology knowledge and experimental abilities.
olympiads.examStructure: Theoretical (100 MCQs/short answer) + Practical (experimental tests) + Group Project

olympiads.name: International Olympiad in Informatics
olympiads.subject: Computer Science
olympiads.description: Programming competition focusing on algorithms and data structures.
olympiads.eligibility: Under 20 years (by June 30), currently in high school
olympiads.examStructure: Two days, 3 problems each day, 5 hours per day, C++ programming

resources.title: USACO Guide
resources.description: Comprehensive guide to competitive programming with curated problems and solutions.

resources.title: Codeforces
resources.description: Active competitive programming community with regular contests.

olympiads.name: International Olympiad of Linguistics
olympiads.subject: Linguistics
olympiads.description: Unique olympiad testing logic and pattern recognition through linguistic puzzles.
selectionProcess: Himalayan Computational Linguistic Olympiad (HLON) - national selection
notableAlumni: 2023 HLON winners represented Nepal at IOL 2023 (Bulgaria)
